result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie A. Byrd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie A. Byrd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for Jamie A. Byrd
Current: P.O. Box 1061, Fulton, KY 42041 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2015)
Prior: 8776 E. Minch, Minocqua, WI 54548 United States

02:15 pm - Defendant Jamie A. Byrd in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm49 and 15cm119.  State moves to dismiss 15cm119 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to the single count in 15cm49.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine $579 (inclusive of all costs)
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:57 pm - Defendant Jamie A. Byrd in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm49 and 15cm119.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.   
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

02:33 pm - MAM for PFO - Defendant Jamie A. Byrd in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm119 and 15cm49 - Defendant states was found to be ineligible for PD - Defendant requests a two week adjournment.  Will be retiring from current employment.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:36 pm - Defendant Jamie A. Byrd in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to contacting PD.  Defendant states did not contact PD office.  Defendant will proceed on own.  Has now decided to contact PD to determine eligiblity.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jamie A. Byrd not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
